definitions: remove something using a sharp implement

examples.text: once the loaf is out of the oven, it's very tempting to cut off a piece to try

definitions: stop the provision of something, especially power or water

examples.text: the electricity has been cut off within the hotel
their internet service has been cut off

definitions: prevent someone from receiving or being provided with something, especially power or water

examples.text: consumers may be cut off for nonpayment

definitions: prevent someone from having access to somewhere or someone

examples.text: the couple were cut off by a fast-moving tide
we were cut off from reality

shortDefinitions: prevent someone from having access to somewhere or someone

definitions: block the usual means of access to a place

examples.text: the caves were cut off from the outside world by a landslide

definitions: interrupt someone while they are speaking

examples.text: he cut her off and went on to another subject

shortDefinitions: interrupt someone while they are speaking

definitions: interrupt someone during a phone call by breaking the connection

examples.text: I listened to prerecorded messages for twenty-three minutes before being cut off

shortDefinitions: interrupt someone during telephone call by breaking connection

definitions: reject someone as one's heir; disinherit someone

examples.text: Gabrielle's family cut her off without a penny

synonyms.text: have nothing more to do with

definitions: drive aggressively into the path of another driver while overtaking

examples.text: he told troopers he lost control of his truck after a vehicle cut him off

shortDefinitions: overtake someone and pull in too closely
